page.title: 19Muchelney Pottery (1)
page.content: When John Leach was looking for a suitable property to carry on his craft he wanted somewhere that would be peaceful.He found his ideal in a low,stone and thatch cottage south of Muchelney.The cottage used to be a farm labourers home but it now houses Mr Leach's family and the pottery workshops.There are two workrooms,the clayroom and the throwing room. Behind the house is the firing shed and the small shop where the pottery is displayed and sold.The clay used is from Devon and is woodfired to produce a stoneware pottery for everyday domestic use.John and his assistant Nick work side_by_side preparing clay,throwing pots and preparing the kilns for firing.This task takes over 24 hours,is hot,tiring,allowing little time for sleep.
